channel.title: Swift on Dmitry M - Veridis Quo

item.title: Swift optionals for Objective-C programmers
item.description: I’m trying my hand at some iOS programming after being away for a while. At this point it does not make sense to start a new project in Objective-C so I started in Swift. Overall, Swift is very readable and I’m fairly productive right out of the gate. One of the new language features that not familiar though, is Optionals. Due to Objective-C’s, C lineage you could do things like this:
